channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024021287
item.description:
Report X-2024021287

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO UNLOAD 1 DOOR 26 FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED PACKAGE AND CLEANED UP MATERIALS IN A SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024021165
item.description:
Report X-2024021165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DRUM UNLOADED FROM CHAR TRAILER DAMAGED. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF DAMAGED HAZMAT. DescribePack: CRIMPED LID OPEN DUE TO DENTS IN DRUM BODY AND LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE REORIENTED THE DRUM INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.
